stories.text:
Razorpay is an Indian payment platform[1].

Recently Indian police arrested[2] the co-founder of a fact-checking website for a tweet he did in 2018.

Police demanded the data of the donors to the fact-checking website from Razorpay and they complied without a court order[3].

1:https://www.ycombinator.com/companies/razorpay

2:https://www.firstpost.com/india/explained-the-two-cases-against-alt-news-co-founder-mohammed-zubair-and-the-reason-for-his-arrest-10844721.html

3: https://inc42.com/buzz/razorpay-alt-news-controversy-spotlight-on-data-security-user-consent
stories.title: Tell HN: Razorpay a YC company shared donor data without court order
Raft or Not? The Best Solution to Data Consistency in Cloud-Native Databases
New research challenges long-held beliefs about limb regeneration
Google’s patented solution to an eSIM limitation is coming to Android 13

stories.text:
Hi!

I have a photo of a book page from what seems to be some business book, but I haven't made notes which book or even which page number this is from.

(Note to self: always make sure you've got the whole page in your photo, not just the sentences you found noteworthy!)

The passages are "there is a surfeit of management at the top and a simultaneous dearth of leadership", "You lead people; you manage things" and – at the top – a quotation: "Have you seen them? Which way did they go? I must be after them, for I am their leader!"

Someone here probably knows this off-hand, it's almost certainly a very well-known book, and if it's a business book, chances are I've got the recommendation from HN.
stories.title: Crowd HN: In which book is this passage?
Reinforcement Learning – Government Intervention in Catastrophe Insurance [pdf]
